intro: Hieracium davidsonii, commonly known as Davidson's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
